1554110095_18n7wVi3xtKGEp4a4BYPuhEdfMszt.body:
jeej: very few want to fight piracy in Russia. Most see piracy as free advertisement. For example, when the hit Left For Dead 2 was hiting the shelves, i volunteered to make a legal case against pirates. I was wanting to buy a legal copy and they sold me pirated one lying it was genuine. I was willing to come back with distributors and police and make a case. The distributors were not interested, not a tiniest bit.

Those who are interested - they may start crawling VK and taking down movies, etc. Russian hit movies usualyl do. Because they care. Wester movies just do not give a thing.

i wonder if Linux 0install can be used as smoe starting point.
i mean, they separate the storage cache, which is hash-named, and logical file paths (here it would be zites and their folders), recreating latter through symlinks

> [youknownothing](#comment_1_17FiRbZZvpgdkSUeVv3qbqKjTe9DDea1d8): Thanks, but this is for Linux only.

i did not say you can just take it and use it as it is. Afterall uploading files is not installing programs.

i said "starting point" - for ideas, for example of implementing functions like cross-user de-duplication, etc.
 
Those functions, their generic design, you can learn from them and then use the sam methods in your program. Of course you would have to code them yourself.
